job_title: CNA in High Point, NC
pros: Great company. Would work here again.
cons: None. Great company to work for.

review_title: Terrible hospital system to work in.
job_title: Pharmacy Technician in High Point, NC
pros: Work and home life balance is good.
cons: Hostile work environment. Not many great people to work with. Starting pay is not great for the work you do and, as the youngest person at the time, the seniors are incredible bullies. As a part time worker, your benefits are horrible.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in High Point, NC
pros: Benefits, Staff like family, BTO,Pay,Schedule
cons: Lazy nurses, night shift nurses on Facebook, Face time all night.

job_title: Registered Nurse in High Point, NC
pros: Good manager and good coworkers, small hospital
cons: Pt ratio too high and some rude, upper management doesn’t back you ip

job_title: Secretary in High Point, NC
pros: High Point Regional has great nurses as well as excellent volunteers who take time out to assist patients and employees across the hospital. Unfortunately, you do not see recognition for their hard work and instead give recognition to the ones who sit there, talk trash, and belittle one another.
cons:
Management tell you one thing to get you though the door and lie afterwards. The employees here have egos with nothing to back them up. The staff puts you down and make your feel like nothing. They will talk down to you, look down to you, and make you feel worthless.

 The technology is horrible and IT likes to add crap on crap instead of fixing it. The cafeteria food is horrid, and the place smells of death. Management is horrible and they wonder why their turnover rate is ridiculous.

job_title: CNA in High Point, NC
pros: Loved most of my co-workers and still miss a lot of them after leaving. We were a great team
cons: Short staffed. Was the only CNA to a 30 bed unit many nights, working with sundowners, dementia, withdrawals, and everything in-between. Upper management cared more about getting a good review from patients than giving proper care. This place was truly a disaster and I cried in my car before every shift. Having difficult patients is one issue, but when you physically cannot care for all your assigned patients and they are all yelling at you because they are all being neglected is a whole other issue that no health facility should have.

job_title: in High Point, NC
pros: Great place to work. People were always welcoming. Nice training program and competitive pay. I really enjoyed my time here.
cons: I had a hard time working third shift and these were the only PRN shifts that were offered on my unit at that time. I would have liked to have seen other opportunities given in other time slots.

job_title: ICU RN in Winston-Salem, NC
pros: Great coworkers, good docs, scheduling is also good. The overall work environment is positive and cheerful. I always felt appreciated
cons: Upper management needs some work. I think a lot of these folks have been behind a desk for too long and have forgotten what nursing is really like

job_title: CNA in High Point, NC
pros: The best reasons to work here is only to avoid being unemployed. The benefits are pretty good. The schedule allows you some flexibility in maintaining a good work-life balance.
cons: The do not follow their values....They treat patients like they are not fit to make their own decisions.Employees such as CNAS are treated like they are incompetent. My co-worker is the best CNA I have ever seen and she has had enough....

review_title: Cascading and I feel they cannot downsize and restructure enough to save the company.
job_title: Registered Nurse in High Point, NC
pros: Geographical location was one of the reasons.
cons:
Staff unprofessional. Staff create an environment that puts license at risk and management allows and also creates certain monsters itself. HPRHS is not the same company when I was hired.

Raises are not discussed and pushed back in time.

job_title: Facilities in High Point, NC
pros: Many dedicated employees who care about the jobs and most of all care about the patients.
cons: It is a difficult place to work when you are constantly having to navigate a political mine field. Senior leadership has created an environment that pit employees against each other. Senior leaders have their own agendas which usually means they are looking out for themselves. They constantly hire consults to do their job when all of them are making high 6 figure incomes.

job_title: Registered Nurse in High Point, NC
pros: Small community hospital with a family like environment.  The regional hospitalist are great to work with and we finally have a CEO with a vision.
cons: Nursing is struggling and pay is not competitive.  Some of the leadership are still from the old circle and only care about looking good vs making the environment better.

job_title: Nursing Staff in High Point, NC
pros: Most of the regular staff are really good people that care about their patients
cons: Senior Leadership has become a pathetic group of buddies who have totally lost sight of humanity.

job_title: Admissions Assistant in Winston-Salem, NC
pros: great benefits, wonderful people to work with, hospital was always clean, people were friendly and helpful, volunteers were a huge part of their customer service
cons: supervisors and managers were never willing to discuss decisions that concerned the entire department, the way the lay offs were handled were, in my opinion, harsh with very little reasoning as to why certain people who had been there for years were let go over newer employees

job_title: RN Transitional Care in High Point, NC
pros: autonomy, flexibility good team to work with. the doctors were great. community service and follow-up with patients was a benefit. helping to prevent pt. attrition and readmission was effective.
cons: distance from home.t. some employees need diversity training. being uncomfortable working with different employees helps one relate to people in the community.

job_title: Registered Nurse in High Point, NC
pros: Very good company to work for. They always tried to be focused on the team, and offered ways to advance or seek higher knowledge.
cons: Patient ratio to nurse could always be improved. Also, the average nurse's hourly pay rate could be increased to meet the market and standard of living.

job_title: Secretary in High Point, NC
pros: Safe place to work. Comfortable work environment.
cons: Each day the hospital merged with another facility, everyone held their breath, knowing that 100+ people would be leaving, and not on their own free will. I realize hospitals are becoming a liability due to ER’s full of patients that can not pay.
